ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Drinking alcohol is good.
Drinking alcohol is positive.
Drinking alcohol is beneficial.
Drinking alcohol is enjoyable.
Drinking alcohol is fun.
Drinking alcohol is relaxing.
Drinking alcohol is pleasurable.
Alcohol Attitudes Scale Average
I drink alcohol because of: Ceremonies or celebrations, such as weddings or birthdays
I drink alcohol because of: Daily routine, including drinking with meals or part of daily life
I drink alcohol because of: Pressure from friends
I drink alcohol because of: Drinking can improve my physical health
I drink alcohol because of: Situations where I drink with my business partners or coworkers or colleagues
I drink alcohol because of: Feeling sad or depressed
I drink alcohol because of: To celebrate a personal success (such as a salary raise, a new motorbike)
In the past 3 months, how many people have you talked with about reducing alcohol use?
In the past 3 months, have you had 3 or more alcoholic drinks within a 3-hour period?
In the past 3 months, have you had 3 or more alcoholic drinks within a 3-hour period, 3 or more times?
In the past 3 months: Did you need to drink more in order to get the same effect that you did when you first started drinking? For example, has your drinking capacity increased?

In the past 3 months: When you cut down on drinking did your hands shake, did you sweat, or feel agitated? Or, did you drink to avoid these symptoms or to avoid being hungover, e.g., ''the shakes'', sweating or agitation?
In the past 3 months: During the times when you drank alcohol, did you end up drinking more than you planned when you started?
In the past 3 months: Have you tried to reduce or stop drinking alcohol but failed?
In the past 3 months: On the days that you drank, did you spend substantial time in obtaining alcohol, drinking, or in recovering from the physical effects of alcohol?
In the past 3 months: Did you spend less time working, enjoying hobbies, or being with others because of your drinking?
In the past 3 months: Have you continued to drink even though you knew that the drinking can cause health or mental problems?
